Reviews.Title: Love it. Cystal Clear Screen. Easy Set up.
Reviews.Author: honestreviewer
Reviews.Content: Received this Sony 42" LED HDTV last week and I already own the 32" LED HDTV 1080p so I knew it would be just as great. Well it is better than I hoped it would be. Set up was super easy. The screen is sharper than my 32" size. You can watch this TV in a dark room and it adjusts to its environment. Same with a bright light on. From every angle you can see this TV clearly. This is in our living room. Perfect size. Highly Recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: sony joy
Reviews.Author: Jerry F. Coleman "Gator"
Reviews.Content: The Sony quality is very evident: sound quality, picture sharpness, menu layout is all good. The led display is an improvement over the lcd which I previously own. It is lighter, thinner, with sharper image. Delivery was on time with no damage. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia LED exceeds expectarions!
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: Great television. Extremely easy set-up. Great picture and good sound for the bedroom. I highly recommend this TV.  Very light TV was a snap to mount on wall.

Reviews.Title: Great TV... Beware of ordering from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Bargain Shopper
Reviews.Content: We wanted a TV that had a nice picture for a nice price.  We've been pleased with our current Sony TV, just needed one a little larger.  We ordered the first TV and the box and TV arrived damaged.  We figured this was just a fluke so we returned that one and ordered another TV.  The second arrived more damaged than the first... all the Styrofoam corners were smashed and the box had been punctured at the bottom, breaking the area of the TV where the stand sits.  We returned that one and went to a B&M; retailer to purchase the TV.  It appears that the damage is occurring in Amazon's warehouse before being sent to the customer, as both times the box appeared to be punctured by a forklift and then re-taped over that area.I highly recommend the TV, just purchase it from somewhere other than Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, needs adjustment for gaming
Reviews.Author: Gustave M. Groth
Reviews.Content: As you may of known the "motionflow xr 120" is just a b.s. number they throw up to make it look a class higher, its a 60HZ tv as per sony support.The tv has a very nice picture but hurts a bit with movement.  I noticed a lot of judder and motionblur in the tv, not so much during movies as gaming, though it is there through both.Talking to sony support they gave me a page (will be under the review) and it greatly helped though did not fully get rid of it.My old Vizio LCD 120hz from 2008 had no problems between tv, gaming, etc.  For this tv you will need to switch between settings when playing games or watching tv.TV was one nighted from amazon with no damage.  I couldn't tell you about the sound as I use a surround sound unit.  The TV is very thin though, so thin that if you swivel on a mount you can see the tv flex a bit.  The screen has little to no protection, as even if you barely touch it, it looks like you are pushing hard into it (the wave/colors).(I did find a game mode, but its under "scene" on the remote, not picture nor menu)Per sony website/supportThere is a lag or delay in the picture when playing a video game.SolutionThis can potentially occur on a High-Definition Television (HDTV) because of the built-in noise reduction and other picture adjustment circuitry designed to enhance the quality of high-resolution content. Although great when watching video from other sources, this circuitry can slow the reaction time from your controller and what you see on the TV screen when playing a video game.If your TV has a Game mode, you can resolve this issue by going into the TV menu and turning the Game mode to On . This will disable any noise-reduction and picture adjustment circuitry and allow the video game signal into the TV without slowing the response time.However, if your TV does not have a Game mode, you will need to check the Video or Picture menu of your TV and manually set any of the following options to Off :¡Noise Reduction¡Dynamic Range Control (DRC)¡Motion Enhancer¡CineMotion

Reviews.Title: Excellent Purchase"
Reviews.Author: JGD
Reviews.Content: Exceptional picture with deep color tones and vivid colors.Perfect weight and clean design.The setup is easy and making this Bravia a perfect purchase.

Reviews.Title: LED
Reviews.Author: Krunal
Reviews.Content: I really like this TV. Awesome picture clarity, thin LED screen and big 42 screen. The only part i don't like is that USB can only play .mpeg or .mpg movies. It cannot play other famous movie extensions like .avi, .mp4 etc. The good thing about this TV is that it supports 110V to 240V so that you can use anywhere in the world. Amazon does not charge tax that's plus point.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with purchase
Reviews.Author: trac
Reviews.Content: Great picture and sound.  THe tv itself is beautiful. Bought it for my husband for his birthday and he loves it.  His playstation looks amazing on it, movies, tv, it's all good.  I love our new Sony Bravia.

Reviews.Title: solid value
Reviews.Author: Michael Case
Reviews.Content: I was not terribly excited to replace our recently dead Philips 42" lcd tv.  A new TV was not really in the budget, it was important that the replacement represented a good value.  I looked at several options, but eventually settled on this Sony 42" LED model.  At ~$500 it was roughly 1/2 the price the Philips was 4 years ago.  The Sony, while not as thin as some today, has a much thinner profile, bezel, and lighter weight than the TV it replaces.  Since we weren't wall mounting this wasn't super important for us, but it was much more pleasant lugging the box in and installing thanks to the lighter weight.  Installation and basic setup was easy, taking about 15 minutes.I was a little disappointed in the lack of input options available on this model.  The two HDMI, RGB Component, Co-ax, and VGA are all nice, but I would have liked to see the older composite video input option included as well (UPDATE turns out the green input from the component input can be used along with the red and white inputs for composite).  The menus and firmware are nothing special, but easy to use.  There's no fancy TV apps available here, but at this price I don't consider that a problem.Picture quality is acceptable.  I'm still fiddling with the color and contrast settings trying to find a good compromise between vivid colors and realisitic flesh tones.  Wierdly, with the Live Color setting set to High, colors are both too vivid AND too washed out at the same time.  Reds, blues, and greens are way too strong, while flesh tones and browns are muted.  I suspect some more time tweaking the menu options will find a happy medium.  Overall contrast performance seems much better than my old Philips, with less of the black brightening and dimming due to the active backlighting in that model.On the whole I'm very impressed for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: howeroyt
Reviews.Content: Great looking TV, easy set up, easy to operate, great picture, nice remote no mystery here, great addition to my cable set up - acquired at a great price from Amazon

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV, very intuitive..
Reviews.Author: Jack McFarlane
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I am a Sony guy when it comes to tvs. I couldn't believe a 42"  led would be as cheap as this was!  It works seamlessly with my Sony Bluray player, as did the last one, but there's no more switching between inputs. When the bluray player comes on, the input automatically switches.The only downside I can think of is the two hdmi inputs. I was looking for at least three, but that's all I can think of.A great purchase, great price, and brilliant picture. Got it just in time for Thanksgiving and must have gotten about 20 compliments on it.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Top Quality and Great Value
Reviews.Author: ALS
Reviews.Content: We really love this Sony! This TV provides crystal clear and vivid displays with very smooth motion. The speakers provide much better sound quality and volume as compared to other flat screen TVs. This 42 inch model will fit the space of many other 40 inch types due to efficiently thin screen borders.

Reviews.Title: Nice basic HDTV for the price!
Reviews.Author: S. Ley
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a reasonably priced but quality TV from a major manufacturer, and was willing to give up "smart" features and 3D. For that goal, I am very satisfied with this Sony. The panel is bright and clear, with reasonable off-axis performance. The picture settings were adjusted by eye using the AVS HD free calibration disc, and the default "Standard" picture setting was already very close to the calibrated settings. I had no trouble setting a good white level and black level, and despite being only Edge Lit, the backlight is very even without clear bright spots or patchiness. Controls are simple and effective, and easy to setup.Pros:- Good picture quality and good default picture settings- Easy to adjust picture quality for fine tuning.- Easy setup and intuitive remote- Great TV for people who want good picture quality, but who don't need a ton of fancy features- A few nicer features of modern TVs, LED lighting, auto-brightness adjust and 120HzCons:- Slightly limited number of digital inputs (2 HDMI and 1 VGA)- Remote is simpler variety that can't control non-Sony equipment (like the slightly nicer remotes from Sony can)

Reviews.Title: lovin it. Sony rocks!
Reviews.Author: Raffa "Raffa"
Reviews.Content: Love this TV. It looks beautiful, thin, clean, elegant. Image is great. Even on analog cable it looks fantastic. Digital channels and HD look amazing. Has good sound. Enough inputs/outputs for my needs. It has no or minimun light leakage on the edges. Uniformity is really really good. Real good, easy to use functions and menu. Super easy setupIf you're looking for a TV with great image and look with none of that fancy "smart whatever, very expensive stuff" which u dont really use unless u spend lots of time at your tv, this is it.The Sony quality is evident.

Reviews.Title: BEST Flat Screen Yet --- in our home
Reviews.Author: Michelle B. "Originally from Kansas"
Reviews.Content: Years ago, I had a SONY TV that just would not die.  They historically have lasted forever in our family.  However, now with the flat screens, for some reason, we hesitated about purchasing a Sony.This is our 3rd LED/LCD flat screen TV in our home.  The first, a Sharp Aquos, purchased 4 years ago; the second, an LG purchased 2 years ago; and now this one.  I did a lot of research before purchasing each TV.  I love all 3 - but this SONY Bravia KDL42EX440 has by far the clearest, crispest, picture....and really great sound...and was the LEAST expensive.  Not only that, we paired it with a Sony Blu-ray player and we get access to EVERYTHING... well, not everything, but to a lot of content.We ordered through Amazon - and had Amazon ship it with NO issues.  We did not experience the problems other reviewers have mentioned.I would purchase another one of these TV's in a heartbeat....

Reviews.Title: High Quality, Great Price
Reviews.Author: J. G. Bormann
Reviews.Content: Box arrived partially opened (hence the deduction of star) which scared the bejeezus out of me, but finished the UPS man's unwrapping job and fired it up, everything works and after a brief manual calibration, its the sharpest display in the house. All ports work and mounting hardware functions. Very straightforward setup. Hate Amazon's tracking system and their customer service is crap, but this particular product is A-OK in my book

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: This could be the best TV I've ever owned. SO energy efficient, bright, colorful, and the blacks are BLACK. I use this as a huge computer monitor all the time, and the HD is incredible. I'd recommend this any day. The price is outstanding for this kind of quality. Remember to buy a mounting bracket and heavy toggle bolts if you're putting this on a wall!I was able to mount this on drywall with heavy duty toggle bolts and a simple tilting mounting bracket.

Reviews.Title: Sony review revisited: Auto dim problem *SOLVED*
Reviews.Author: WC Alaska
Reviews.Content: Recently we replaced our dead Olevia flat screen with this Sony.For the first month of use I was constantly frustrated. I watch a bit of B-Screen horror and Sci-fi with lots of dark scenes. I tried many times to adjust the settings for dark scenes, and I disabled the auto-dim in the setup menu. Nothing worked. Frustrated, I gave the TV a one star rating because the dark scenes were virtually unwatchable, they were so dark.I googled the problem and finally found a solution. You have to go to the "scene" called "Music" then go to settings, video settings. Under advanced settings, you will find a checkbox for "detect dark scenes and dim." Check no, then exit menu. Voila! No more auto dimming on dark scenes!Once I was able to turn that off, I stuck with the Music scene and did some tweaks to get the picture the way I like it. Now the picture quality is beautiful! My faith is restorerd in Sony quality. My best guess is that the "detect dark scenes and dim" box is an "exception" rule that ships in "off" mode but somehow it shipped with the auto-dim turned on by accident.I'm re-rating it from one star to four, I would have given it a five if not for all the effort I had to put into it to get it to display how I wanted it look in the first place.Now that I know how to fix this issue, I'm getting the 32 inch Bravia for our bedroom! :-)  So, yes I recommend buying this product.

Reviews.Title: Great Value.
Reviews.Author: Pai Gow
Reviews.Content: I'm not really a high tech person as I purchased this to replace a 13 year old, 230 pound, standard def,32 inch Sony Wega.  I've always wanted a new tv for the front, but that old tube of mine just kept running.  Well this was such a great deal that I had to pull the trigger ($518 less 10%).  The tv looks great to me.  I told myself that I wouldn't buy a 60hz, but in the end, the reviews were so good that I thought it would be better to buy a high quality 60hz than a low quality 120hz.  Now I may be misguided in what high and low quality mean, but I just thought it would be better to get this Sony than a loaded Vizio for the same price.  All that aside, the tv looks fine to me.  I've never really been an HD fan, I just wanted a bigger screen and this does the job.  The picture is pretty good though, but I'm going from a 32 standard def to this, so take that comment with a grain of salt.  If you are similar to me and are looking for something that won't disappoint, this will do the job.  As most have said, the only drawback is the lack of inputs.  If you don't have video games, then you should be fine, but with directv and a blue ray, you have no choice but to use component cables to connect your xbox or ps3.

Reviews.Title: Sony vs Samsung | DVR content better on Sony
Reviews.Author: M. McCasland
Reviews.Content: Our old Sony tube HD set (12 years old) went out.  I did some basic research, went to BestBuy to look at TVs, and ended up buying a very highly rated Samsung (UN40EH6030).  It arrived with the Disney TV calibration disk (Wow: World of Wonder) and I dialed it in.  DVD images were stunningly good -- the best I've ever seen on any TV; however, output from my Tivo Premiere HD was frankly poor with HD content -- and SD content was practically unwatchable.  I changed output settings, recalibrated many times, and would fool myself into thinking it looked good.  Yet, when I left the room and came back or slept on it and saw it the next day, my immediate feeling what the picture looked poor.  When my wife said something out of the blue, I knew I wasn't dreaming.So I purchased this Sony in hopes of tapping into our decade+ of good luck and excellent picture quality we used to enjoy with our tube-HD TV.  Out of the box, this TV caused my heart to sink.  The picture was not at all good: way too saturated color, blown-out white levels, very dull picture, etc.  However, I spent about 20 minutes working with it (mainly turning down/off alot of the intelligent contrast and black level controls, decreasing brightness, decreasing sharpness, decreasing backlight, etc...).  When I was done, the SD/HD content from Tivo looked much better than I could ever get with days of playing/calibrating the Samsung -- as well as better than what our old tube-HD set could display.  And all of that was just me "eyeing it" -- I have yet to use the calibration DVD since the picture looks so good as is.DVD output looks good as well (but the Samsung looked better).  If we solely watched DVDs, I would have stuck with the Samsung.Also, I notice a little pixelation on fast graphics that was not present in the Samsung.  Yet, the overall picture quality on non-DVD sources is so much better that I can gladly live with the issues (and don't feel like spending double more to get a Sony XBR model to fix these minor drawbacks).In the end, we're sticking with the Sony and have returned the Samsung due to 95% of our viewing is Tivo in HD with some SD thrown-in; only occasionally do we watch a DVD.  We never watch (or like) 3D content.  Also, all the "Smart TV" stuff is on another flat-panel of ours -- and we never use it (Tivo provides Amazon/NetFlix streaming, photos, etc.).  So the lack of "smartness" is actually a plus in our eyes.  In the end, it seemed like a no-brainer to go with the screen that shows DVR HD/SD content the best -- the content we watch the most.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV after extensive research...
Reviews.Author: L'wood
Reviews.Content: I searched high and low to replace my 42" Panasonic Plasma that was so old it was only an SD (480P) set.  Light in the new room it's in was too much for Plasma, so LED/LCD it had to be.  The picture of this TV was far and away better than the competition, especially VISIO, even though only 2 HDMI inputs is a bit on the cheep side, although there aren't many places to put inputs on these thin Panels.Another thing to remember with this TV is it is a 42", and many MFG's are making a 39-40" then jumping to a 47", with nothing in between - 2 inches might not seem like much, but it's bigger than you think, just ask a wife.All in all very satisfied and would definitely purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded Expectations
Reviews.Author: Irina Yelanchik
Reviews.Content: This Sony Tv exceeded my expectations. The picture quality is just beautiful and the difference from my old Sony LCD HDTV was visible right away. For the price this television is well worth it. The contrast from white to black is amazing and the LED technology is doing its job in this tv. Some features were sacrificed due to the cheaper price such as 120Hz refresh rate, a higher contrast ratio, and 3D and smart options but for me the cheaper price was more appealing. All in all if you are willing to sacrifice some of the more high end features you will still end up with an amazing tv that has beautiful picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: MJ
Reviews.Content: I'll just comment on the relevant things. Picture quality is very good, I calibrated this TV and the Gamma, Lumminance and Color Temp can be close to reference with the controls available. Blue color on the upper end of the greyscale cannot be dialed in with the controls available. Sound is very adequate and can get loud in a normal room. I play Black ops everyday and I'm very sensitive with lag. Im happy to report that this TV is very good with lag, unnoticeable I should say. Screen does blur a little bit when playing black ops but nothing too distracting. Overall a great budget TV. The only reason I give it 4 stars is because of the uniformity. Flashlighting is present as well as clouding all over the screen. Also my TV came with a dead pixel. If these issues are irrelevant to you i say go for it.

Reviews.Title: Don't be fooled by LED this is an LCD (And an excellent one).
Reviews.Author: CC
Reviews.Content: So this item gets 5 stars for what it is. A older (not really that old) LCD version of the Sony Bravia Version.THE ONLY ISSUE I HAVE WITH THIS IS HOW IT SAYS LED. To the average consumer they may think they're getting a killer deal on an LED TV (which in my opinion LED is the better technology). The reality of things are this is "LED Backlit" which in all honesty doesn't mean anything. It doesn't improve image quality and despite the goal of the LED backlighting to brighten the picture I've seen LCD TV's without the backlight which look just as bright.That being said...This is an excellent LCD television offered by Sony. The Bravia series is top notch in the industry. The price is great too on this unit.I give it 5 stars because I'm reviewing an LCD television but would really like to see it made clear for the average customer that this is and LCD and not an LED.I'm extremely happy with this purchase. I'm not happy about the clarity of how this is an LCD television but at the same time a bit of research (which people should do when investing in expensive electronics) customers will discover that this is indeed just an LCD television.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: RickyZ
Reviews.Content: This TV has a nice crisp picture with incredible color. It also has good built in sound. It's also a nice looking TV. The stand is sturdy, but I think Sony could have provided a swivel stand with this TV.  My only complaint is the blacks, sometimes it pixelates and doesn't give a good pure black. But overall, a great TV.

Reviews.Title: No complaints here!
Reviews.Author: rosenro+
Reviews.Content: Upgrading a television isn't easy, especially with a the new technology they are always shelling out these days - but I did want this to be a dramatic upgrade from what I had before, which was an Insignia 32 Inch 720p (I bought 4 years ago at Best Buy for 450$) - for a college student, I figured that was a good deal at the time.Anyway, so I read the basics of the Sony Bravia, and I get hopeful. Not only is it energy-saving (if you're a green sustainability type like myself), but it's 42' inch, which is perfect size for any bedroom or living room - not too big, not too small. It also doesn't get any better than 1080p, unless you want 3D. Honestly, I couldn't give a crap less, since I'm still stuck in the Blu-Ray era (I'm a college girl, but with an old lady mentality.) I just wanted significantly better picture (720p vs 1080p), a bigger screen (from 32' to 42'), and better sound, which was a tad of an annoyance for me with my Insignia. Unless I had this thing turned up all the way, I couldn't really hear much. My husband also is hearing impaired, and I asked him what he thought about it. Well, we watch Breaking Bad on Netflix every night with no problem, and sometimes it can almost get too loud!To test out the quality of the picture, I popped in the official test - Lord of the Rings on Blu-Ray. If you're a LotR nerd like me, I also suggest you get the newly updated Blu-Ray version of the series, and a Sony Bravia, if you're on a college budget... because I realize things that I haven't seen the other 2342657423135436 times I saw these movies. It's crisp, not overly saturated, and the textures look unbelievably realistic.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable picture
Reviews.Author: Patrick Haider
Reviews.Content: I reviewed several TV’s, and decided on a Samsung 40”.  Each channel, the color tone seemed to change and I could not get a consistent picture. The Samsung also had a gloss finish on the screen, it caused a glare and it was difficult to view at times. It did not live up to the reviews that were given and it was returned.I purchased this Sony 42”; out of the box the quality was evident.  The screen has a satin finish and there were no glare issues.  The set up was easy, and the picture without any adjustments was excellent.I’m very satisfied with this Sony product, and highly recommend it if you are looking for  a low price TV with an exceptional picture.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional picture quality
Reviews.Author: Northern lights
Reviews.Content: I'm not a expert on the latest and greatest led tv's out there, but the Sony Bravia has to be right up there at the top with picture quality.After watching a few football games on this tv, I don't know how it could be any clearer and crisp other than to be at the game in person.  This is a excellent led tv, five stars+ and I highly recommend it if your shopping for a new tv.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Virenderj Singh "viru"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV recently after studying lots of other models. The TV setup was very easy and it connected to Dish Hopper easily(I mean no effort or configuration on my side). The Dish Remote started working with TV easily (I am truly surprised).The picture is excellent and TV sound is also strong enough for me not feel to add a sound bar for it. I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Solid product.  Superb value.
Reviews.Author: bcbit01
Reviews.Content: Exactly as represented. Not the greatest thing ever but it was a $550 TV and does a damn good job.  People can say whatever critical things they want to stroke their own ego but Sony makes good stuff.  I've slowly replaced all the electronics in my house with Sony and am VERY satisfied.  You will be too.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: William LINDER
Reviews.Content: I hesitated for a while before purchasing it its a great tv picture quality great sound great now on to replace my living room tv with another tv now too

Reviews.Title: Great Bedroom TV!
Reviews.Author: Sheila D Smith
Reviews.Content: Our 6Th Sony TV and it does what we purchased it for.  When 3 D does not require cheap glasses we will purchase one.

Reviews.Title: MY TV BOX WAS MARKED EX44, IT IS AN EX440 HERE ARE THE FACTORY SPECS
Reviews.Author: donny "DONALD"
Reviews.Content: THIS IS AN LCD TV WITH LED BACKLIGHTING... IT'S ENERGY EFFICIENT BECAUSE IT DOESNT USE CCFL BULBSmy SONY EX44 LCD tv came well packaged in a double box in perfect condition via ups in 3 days free shipping, it arrived before my hdmi cable.. setup was remarkably easy. it read my satellite signal and my sony bluray player. it sensed the type of hookup and it was good to go in 5 minutes after turning it all on. picture is wonderful for a low end unit. my sony bluray has the internet stuff so not needed on this model, besides, it obvious that internet programs will get better and tecnology improve. it will be easier to upgrade a player rather than than buy a whole new tv...i've read other reviews about the sound from  these tv's as being poor or bad or terrible.. i feel the sound from the speakers are just right at normal listening levels. who expects factory speakers to sound like your premium sound system in your car? when i put in a movie, i turn on the bose and we rock. listening to the news or weather and i prefer the tv speakers. i run my tv all night sometimes and you can lower the energy usage along with the brightness, saving on electricity. i might replace my 10 year old bose and get the sony htc260 soundbar so i only need 1 remote. i listened to a sony 260 soundbar and it rocks pretty good for a $270 dollar unit. i like things easy peasey i may purchase an antenna to see how the over the air hd tv works in case my satellite fails during heavy cloud cover.NOTE! Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: TJ
Reviews.Content: Awesome bang for your buck TV, bought it on Cyber Monday. Easily instillation, crystal clear picture, easy settings, great size. Definitely a good purchase, would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: looooooooooooove it!!!
Reviews.Author: soheb.
Reviews.Content: its been 3 months i bought it.no problem at all.crisp picture!!!now the price drop down.but its ok!!! still i love it.

Reviews.Title: Natural images
Reviews.Author: Miguel T
Reviews.Content: When compared to other display TV's, it might seem it is not as bright as the competition, however, I believe this is a marketing strategy to catch the eyes of the buyer, but don't be fooled, images look sharp and clear, much better for similar priced rivals. Besides some issues with HDMI (could not connect my newly bought PC with HDMI 1.4, this might be a cable problem instead but need to do more troubleshooting) this is a great TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: This is a good TV, I recommend you to buy it
Reviews.Author: Ye
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV three years ago, it works well in my home, nothing wrong with it. I like it very much!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Grimes
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Have it in my bedroom. Great picture and sound quality. Very light weight and looks great wall mounted.

Reviews.Title: sooooo happy
Reviews.Author: pr
Reviews.Content: Even my picky son who thinks I never do much right keeps saying how great the picture is on this tv.  I did not pay attention to the digital recovery rate numbers but have not noticed much problem...I dont watch sports.So I love Sony as usual...

Reviews.Title: Good Value, Great picture
Reviews.Author: Rick259g
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new TV for the living room when my 17 year CRT finally died. So much to chose from these days.I wasn't looking for 3D or a "smart" TV, just the best possible picture. I happen to have a Sony Outlet Store near me, so got to see this TV up close. Thought the picture was extremely good...actually better than my 4 year old Panasonic LCD. 42 inches was all I could fit into the cabinet..Amazon had the best price..delivery was excellent and it took me all of 15 minutes to have it up and running. Watched playoff hockey and had no issues with motion blur..same with my kids PS3 and Xbox games. Hopefully, Sony quality will stay true..it's my first Sony TV, I usually get Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: This is a good tv, watch it!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Fahey "TBW"
Reviews.Content: Well, Sony makes a good tv.  I could have used another hdmi input, but two seems to be the standard these days.  They've made input switching a lot easier and it's really easy to hook your computer up now.  I've had a little trouble playing video files from USB, but that's really not an issue for me.  Picture quality is good and the blacks are pretty deep.  It is hard to see it if you have window glare and I'd wished I'd gone to maybe a 48 - 50" screen, but other than that, really happy with it so far.  Oh, I play XBOX on it, through HDMI, is great, no lags or streaking, games look awesome.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia 42 inch tv
Reviews.Author: Julia davis Miller
Reviews.Content: You can not go wrong with this Sony tv.We set it up in our bedroom and the picture and sound is great.Easy to hook up and program.

Reviews.Title: Sony BRAVIA KDL42EX440 42-Inch 1080p LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: jagrja
Reviews.Content: i like this. 4/5.Sony BRAVIA KDL42EX440 42-Inch 1080p LED HDTV.i always like Sony TVs more than anything else. and this meets my expectations.Only problem I am facing is USB is detecting most of the formats.

Reviews.Title: Met expectations!
Reviews.Author: David DiPasquale
Reviews.Content: The TV has met all of our expectations (not a big TV snob/afficionado by any stretch). Worked right out of the box and we love the picture quality.Special shout-out to Amazon for doing an excellent job working with me to meet an unusual shipping request, we were amazed at how well everything went!

Reviews.Title: Worth the price
Reviews.Author: Luis A. Velasquez "Lav9"
Reviews.Content: It's worth it and I love my new tv. Got it fast and the its was packed well. It's been a month and had no problems with tv.

Reviews.Title: sweet
Reviews.Author: b. smith
Reviews.Content: product arrived on time. great picture. i would recommend this to a friend. product arrived undamaged and setup was very minimal

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV at good price
Reviews.Author: ck
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this TV, the colors looks and the sharpness are great, and the energy consumption is very low.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this TV shiped with amazon and its fine had a month i iove this tv

Reviews.Title: 5 stars
Reviews.Author: Eduardo de Guzman
Reviews.Content: I love the tv.  great sound.  Easy to operate and nice color.  it is slim and easy to hang on the wall

Reviews.Title: Highly satisfied customer
Reviews.Author: John J. Rasweiler IV
Reviews.Content: This was a factory refurbished set with a one year factory warranty. When it came out of the factory carton, it looked like new.  Setup was mercifully simple, and performance of the set over the past month has been excellent - superb clarity and color. I had extensively researched this and other sets of the same size, both locally and online. I ultimately concluded, however, that this provided the best performance option and value. Finally, I had been very satisfied with the reliable, good quality service provided by previous Sony TVs.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the Money
Reviews.Author: TC
Reviews.Content: It's a Sony and that says it all. Excellent TV for the money.Like most Sony products out of the box, plug it in, hook-up cable or fiber and a beautiful picture. Like most of the newer flat screens it needs audio help, such as a quality soundbar, etc.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Stuart Schwab
Reviews.Content: I received the Sony BRAVIA KDL42EX440 a month ago. I was a little worried about the home delivery but Amazon did a great job on packing and their delivery date was as promised. I've always done well with Sony products and this was no exception.Unpacking was easy. Three screws installed the stand. Installing the cable and Blu-Ray was intuitive to me, but there is an excellent set-up instruction card included.One of the reasons I bought the 440 was that it's thicker with larger speakers. It sits on a stand in front of a wooden wall so the sound from the TV alone is excellent. The other reason is that I was more interested in picture quality than size and this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Purchase
Reviews.Author: hugh guider
Reviews.Content: This was a christmas present.  Arrived in time,  Very easy set up and installation.  Picture is very nice and sound quality is great.  An excellent TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Television Exceeded My Expectations
Reviews.Author: Gregory Skaff
Reviews.Content: Box arrived a bit beat up, but everything worked great! Beautiful picture - as good if not better than any Samsung television I have viewed. I would recommend the Bravia to anyone.

Reviews.Title: This item replaced a 32 inch XBR Sony that we've had for a number of years.
Reviews.Author: Charles A. Burton
Reviews.Content: The XBR just would not die. I decided to replace it when the warm up time for a clear picture exceeded 2+ minutes. I have known Sony quality for a long time and this model does not disappoint. The picture is excellent and the colors do not over saturate. And best of all, the price was right. at the time of purchase. (Christmas 2012)

Reviews.Title: Picture Perfect
Reviews.Author: Cafe' Connoisseur
Reviews.Content: With so many choices and different technology practically coming out on a monthly basis I was a little confused as to what exact television to purchase.The Sony Bravia is a household name in the television marketplace.Quality lives up to it's name ..What a great picture..

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Photogal
Reviews.Content: We ordered this Sony TV from Amazon because we have one bought at our local Electronics Store, so we knew we wanted this. What was so special is that it arrived within a few days to our door in perfect condition. How very convenient.Thank you Amazon.

Reviews.Title: This TV is Great!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Scot L. Goldberg
Reviews.Content: I love this television.  I bought it for my son for the holidays (2012).  It has a great picture and the price is definitely right.  You can't go wrong with this TV. I have owned several Sony televisions and they are top notch quality sets.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV!!!
Reviews.Author: lrmabenson
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased online and it arrived right on schedule.  It was easy to set up and has an excellent picture.  It gives vivid details and colors.  My wife and I like to watch PGA golf and it was almost like being right at the Waste Management tournament when we watched it today!!!  I'm very happy with this TV!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Jamie Thurman
Reviews.Content: Excellent product and I would recommend to everyone. The picture quality is awesome and set up was a breeze. Great product

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: PN
Reviews.Content: A good brand indeed, nice color blend. Very sharp images and with good quality images. nice sounds from the speakers.

Reviews.Title: Sony is a premium brand and it shows with this tv
Reviews.Author: pclink7
Reviews.Content: I always bought cheap tv's with the exception of an Insignia - Best Buy's brand that I consider a premium item.  I was generally happy with the results. When I decided that I wanted better sound to enjoy Pandora and something to link Amazon Prime tv or the kids Apple tv, then I saw many of the error of my ways. Buying within a family of technology (Sony, Samsung, LG) give you first and foremost, connectivity. Second - image quality is better, at least I can say that about Sony as I own it.First, with low budget tv's - nothing connects. You have islands of technology.  I am not kidding - my kids mocked me in fun that it literally took 6 remotes to utilize one of our tv sets and all the equipment attached. Today I still have multiple items connected: This Sony TV, a Sony Bluray BD390 model (Amazon prime, better sound and IP noise reduction - make it a good choice), and a Sony AV system STR DH520 for exceptional sound plus of course my cable box/DVR.  THE KEY IS ALL WORK NOW WITH THE COMCAST REMOTE. One remote now and the remote of choice for my family as they all know the cable remote already. It's simple too - using Bravia sync, all the Sony items link together one time behind the scene and afterwards all work in unison even through the cable remote.Second, This Sony EX440 picture is exceptionally deep and real. I did not know this till I upgraded but a television like this has a better picture. Regardless if it is 60 or 120 hz, as I have both in my house, the Sony is indeed as crisp even with sports as any 120 hz tv but the photo quality is much better on the Sony - everything looks more real. I am comparing 2012 model tv's when I make that statement too - if your tv is older then you will notice an even bigger difference. With new tv's they look good even a foot away and a Sony looks so real.Getting back to technology simplicity, I bought a 2nd Sony EX440 and Sony BD390 from a local appliance store (at nearly the same price) so that my other Sony surround sound system worked as easy as the first. We have two main tv locations like many family's - downstairs (man cave) and great room.  Both have the same set up and same cable remote driving everything. They are not the biggest but a super real looking 42 inch is more satisfying than the larger one we replaced downstairs.

Reviews.Title: Capt.
Reviews.Author: H2
Reviews.Content: I had a Sony TV previously and it lasted 8 yrs. this may not seem to be long until I tell you the last 2 yrs. the TV was on for 20 hours a day. This new TV has a lot to live up to. Since we have received the new TV it has been put through the test with 18 hour straight tests and a huge range of movies. This TV runs a lot cooler while providing a superior picture. If I were to look for a negative I could only say that it lacks enough hookup options in the back but that's only if your trying to hookup old technology. If your components are up to date then you'll have more than enough. I'll have to wait a few years to rate the longevity. If you want a great TV that is easy to hookup this is the one.  P.S. Don't forget to get a HDMI cable or 2 when you order this. Mediabridge is a great match for this unit.This is the 2nd Product that I have given 5 stars the other 100 or more products I have crushed with no stars.

Reviews.Title: Superb TV!
Reviews.Author: James Mahoney
Reviews.Content: the value was outstamding!  It was delivered in a few days with very nice packing which was easy to remove.  My son had it installed within minutes.  The picture is great.  We are thoroughly enjoying it!

Reviews.Title: A Very Nice TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: buyer
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a nice TV for the price with an excellent picture, good build quality, and adequate sound quality.  The standard settings are close to my preference and only a small adjustment in the Hue and Red was made from the standard to achieve my preference.  This TV is very easy to set-up and the menu is intuitive and very easy to use.  I highly recommend it at this price point.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: John C. Good
Reviews.Content: Sony quality, fantastic picture, full features, great price.$578 price equaled Best Buy low price, however, Best Buy would ship only to a store 100-miles from my home. Amazon shipped free and it was set up and working 3 days later.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Roberta S Patton
Reviews.Content: GREAT SONY TV! We have tried several other brands of tvs and this one is the best!  highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: Sony 42" Bravia
Reviews.Author: Carol Egan
Reviews.Content: We have had this tv for four weeks and we love it.  It's our second flat screen tv.  It was easy to set up.  The picture is superior to our smaller Vizio.  The size is perfect for our modest-sized family room.  The sound is good and easily adjusted for different types of programming.  I would definitely recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Sherry N Emrich
Reviews.Content: Easy set up. Picture is perfect!! The sound is o.k. I have told all my friend to get this one before the playoffs started

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: Ron H.
Reviews.Content: I really like this TV.  The picture is sharp and the color is nice.  I have not set it up for High Definition yet,  but I hear that improves the picture and color.  Thanks for the great service.Ron

Reviews.Title: Nice LCD TV and a nicer price
Reviews.Author: Karla C. Lemus
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful LCD TV. It looks great in the living room, which is why I decided to finally buy a flat panel. I previously had a "big" television and it was not aesthetically pleasing any more. This is not the newest or best model out there but It does the job. The picture is clear, with an HDMI cable you will be happy with the colors and quality. I have a smaller smart tv with wifi and apps but it would of been costlier to buy a 42" smart tv. I simply connect my PS3 to it and I can take advantage of Amazon Video, you tube, Netflix and blue-ray movies.One issues was the tv stand. Getting those screws to stay put was an unexpected hassle, but with some magnets I got them to stay put and tightened them to secure the tv stand to the tv.The shipping was really great and fast. I was surprised since usually Fed Ex leaves me notices in the lobby door. This time they came upstairs and rang my bell.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be better
Reviews.Author: J. R. Liggitt
Reviews.Content: This is really a nice TV--terrific picture and coupled with Direct TV and Roku, it's all we need.  It arrived in record time and was in perfect condition.  The biggest problem we had was in getting rid of our old TV.  Finally found that Goodwill is the way to go. Couldn't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: Love this HDTV - great picture
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: I love this set. It is just the right size for my livingroom. It was easy set up of stand and programming it.  Picture is great. I recommend this for everyone.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: Gail Higdon "Gail Fuller"
Reviews.Content: I had looked for many months to buy a good clear picture tv for my husband. The Sony 1080/120 met my needs. We are very please with it. Easy set up. Delivered on time. I would recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Luis Sanchez Alvarado
Reviews.Content: Everything about this TV is great: image quality, price, etc Works great with the Sony Bluray player I also bought

Reviews.Title: Great Pick.
Reviews.Author: Phil. S
Reviews.Content: I did alot of research on this TV before I purchased it. And I was not let down. A great TV for me so far.

Reviews.Title: High quality and gorgeous picture.
Reviews.Author: HardcoreGamer
Reviews.Content: Replaced a 60 HZ lcd with this TV. The colors really pop, and the quality of the picture in HD is absolutely stunning. Remote seems a little long and unwieldy, but all I really use it for is to turn it on. Setup is easy. Picture and color adjustment is a breeze. Required very little adjustment out of the box. The sound from the TV is good, but I pipe it through the stereo. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!
Reviews.Author: Carlos Moreira
Reviews.Content: Great TV! Sharp image, vivid colors, perfect size and so slim . . . Playing Video games in it is simply great. The package was in perfect condition. The only cons about this is that only have 2 hdmi connections, the rest is just what i wanted.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and design.
Reviews.Author: JMP
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a slightly larger HDTV to replace my old Sharp Aquos LCD which was at least 6 years old. After much research and taking measurements of my entertainment unit for a suitable replacement, I settled on this 42 inch Sony Bravia. The picture quality is outstanding (better than the Aquos) and the on-screen menu with the remote control is intuitive and functional - tweaking the picture with various settings is simple and very effective. I decided to stick with the standard high def component cable connections instead of HDMI because I am running a simple setup and don't plan to use the Sony for connection to a PC or DVR. However, at least I now have the option to do so in the future. The volume has some eq settings but I am using a home theater system for general audio. The picture also auto-adjusts to lighting conditions. All in all, the Bravia is an excellent, attractive LED that is surprisingly light with a slim and sleek design. The enclosed stand attaches to the base with three screws. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: Got this television to replace the old one in the master bedroom. It's an excellent product and the perfect size for the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: it's a SONY
Reviews.Author: Paul H Uyehara
Reviews.Content: what can i say, it's a sony, for the price you can't go wrong, i believe it's not a 120 hz, but the tech behind it's 120 flowmotion i'm please with the tv...as far as shipping, after being notified, recieved it within the week, right on...

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price! It's a SONY!
Reviews.Author: W. Uncapher
Reviews.Content: This TV is a steal for the Amazon price! All the big box stores want way more. It has a terrific picture. Very vivid color. Sharp and clear. Love the LED back-lit panel. No dead pixels! Hooked up is seconds. Turned on and was ready to go. Didn't have to make any adjustments at all. I have Comcast Xfinity cable, and the picture looks great on the factory default settings. I did use the built-in equalizer to increase the bass, midrange and treble to my liking. Love the equalizer feature. Will not have to buy a soundbar. So I'm very happy. I have it connected to my Sony home theather for movies. The sound is very good on this TV, considering most LED/LCD TV's have very poor sound. I highly recommend this TV. Especially considering the fact, leading consumer magazines rate Sony TV's as one of the most reliable brands. Beating out Samsung and LG, as well as many other big brands. Wish it had at least one more HDMI hook-up. It has two, which is adequate. But, would like to have one more just to be there if needed. For the price you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous picture
Reviews.Author: Judith
Reviews.Content: I love my new 42" led Sony Bravia! The picture is absolutely breathtaking! I've always had good luck wit Sony TVs--this is no exception!

Reviews.Title: Sony BRAVIA KDL42EX440 42-Inch 1080p LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: networker
Reviews.Content: So far, SO VERY GOOD. I received TV Jan 10 and had it up and running the same day. I bought this to replace a very nice Sharp AQUOS 37 inch 720P (moving the Sharp to the bedroom). I can definitely see the difference between the two, not that I don't like the Sharp , I love it..my old eyes just needed a bigger viewing area. I called Sony customer service a couple times before this purchase and once the day I received it,they promptly answered all my questions each time. In my experiences with high dollar items such as this, I've found it beneficial to call the company before the purchase...just to find/feel out their personnel. I will update with any downside if found.MARCH 11, 2013AFter 60 days in the hole this unit is still providing stellar results! Very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Back to Black
Reviews.Author: Science Boy
Reviews.Content: I got this to replace my ailing Sony not-so-grand Wega. I am pleased to see that this one exudes a bit more of the old-school Sony quality. The picture is stellar from any digital source and (unfortunately) it really shows up any shortcomings in DVDs and analogue signals (I am going to need a 1080-capable video card for my HTPC now, and an HDMI cable. Even the component (analog) connection from my DVD player is showing its limitations) When viewing from the sofa, blacks are satisfyingly deep, less so once you stand up or move away to the side. Also I'm pleased with the way subtle tones and gradations are handled. I was a bit concerned that for all the wow-factor in the store, an LED-LCD TV might have a slightly unnatural looking picture once I set it up at home. Not so. Not this one anyway. It's really very good. Minuses? Limited number of inputs. I can't connect a composite video signal without disconnecting my component video from the DVD, because there isn't a dedicated jack! Seriously, they must have saved all of 3 cents per unit there. And, although it has every tuner known to man (NTSC, ATSC, QAM), there's only one coaxial input. Wow, saved another 4c there! Granted I can't remember the last time I actually switched on the VCR, and I have decided to eschew cable for now since I get 7 digital channels over the air, but if I wanted to keep just one more non-HDMI source connected, there would be some cursing going on. It's a shock to the system after the old GW which had more inputs than you could ever need. However, I can make it work and when getting this quality of display at this price, you really can't complain. BTW, I looked at the back of several other brands and they all seem to be doing this to some extent on their reasonably-priced models.

Reviews.Title: Not immensely impressed
Reviews.Author: Paul E. Serafini
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying I'm not much of an expert on tv's and related technology.  We bought this to "upgrade" from a smaller bravia we had for years.  We loved it.  Due to my inexperience, I pretty much just went with a "bigger is better" mentality when we ordered this, and didn't really pay attention to many details.  (1) The color on this is very inferior to the older bravia, IMO (2) I would have liked to have more I/O jacks/ports on this model, specifically audio out.  We have started using apple TV, which goes into the TV through an HDMI jack, but the only audio out to the stereo is with a headphone jack (3) The thing that i REALLY hate about this TV is the power switch.  Many/All of the operating controls are in the form of a touch pad on the front of the TV...no "buttons".  So, picture this....it's bedtime, and you're done watching TV for the evening.  You turn off the lights to the room, and then go to tunr off the TV, but you can't find the "button" because it's not there.  Instead, it's a TINY TINY SENSOR, with a TINY TINY label.  Can't possibly see it in the dark.  BAD BAD BAD design.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Seasoned Buyer
Reviews.Content: Bought this in December 2012.  Within two weeks we noticed the screen going from light to dark spontaneously & called Sony customer service.  They told us they were sending a replacement (why not a technician???) which we wrongly assumed was a new TV as ours was only a few weeks old.  WRONG!  We received someone else's problems and are still having the same issues with this one.  Sony customer service is terrible.  We'll never buy Sony again.  Good luck.

Reviews.Title: Good where it counts
Reviews.Author: PennaPA
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this TV has awesome picture and sound.  Colors are bright and vivid, blacks are dark, and everything looks sharp.  The sound on this TV is also surprising for a flat screen TV.  Remote and menus are very simple to use also.  The TV is really thin and light for its size.There are a few major issues with this TV.  First, as noted by other reviewers, Sony's "TrueMotion 120" is deceiving.  It is NOT a 120Hz TV, it is actually 60Hz.  With that said, motion looks really good, but I can still detect a little motion blur.While the menus are simple to use, they don't offer you much in the way of picture adjustments.  You get some scene and picture modes but no dedicated "contrast" or "brightness" or anything like that (at least that I can find).  However, the picture looks great in any mode, so no big issue there.My final issue is that it only has 2 HDMI ports.  I can't really dock a star for this, since I knew this going into the purchase, but for a TV in a den or living room, you may need more ports that that.  We've used up both ports with our DISH receiver and Blu-Ray player already.Overall, if you aren't going to have a lot of HDMI devices, I would recommend this TV (despite its other shortcomings).

Reviews.Title: Geat TV
Reviews.Author: G. Adams
Reviews.Content: Very good TV with all the basic functions.  Picture quality is very good and build quality is solid. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Peggy Johnston "Pegsy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television in December 2012.  I've not had any problems.  The picture is beautiful and the sound is great.  The price was great, too!

Reviews.Title: Great machine thus far
Reviews.Author: C. McMillen
Reviews.Content: It has been over a year now since we bought this TV, and it is working just fine. We hooked Roku up to it a few months ago and that went off without a hitch. We also have a bluetooth disk play attached, and they "talk to each other" with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice for view & sound
Reviews.Author: LT Reviewer
Reviews.Content: We've been using this Sony Bravia in a wall-mounted setting for about a year (purchased in 2013).  The picture & sound quality are excellent, making this t.v. a top choice at this price point.  For reference, we watch HD Comcast cable and use the t.v.'s built-in speakers (no speaker enhancements).To compare, we also purchased the previous Sony Bravia LED version from 2012 and there's a slight improvement in picture quality & a BIG improvement in sound quality between the 2012 & 2013 versions.

Reviews.Title: Works just great!
Reviews.Author: SHAYNE C AUNE
Reviews.Content: It was a great deal for us.  We've had it for about a year now...bought a Sony Blu-ray system and it all works perfect together.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: This TV is my second Sony Bravia, replaced my 32", picture is sharp and clear.  Great with my Sony Blu-Ray player, just like being there when watching DVD or a ballgame.

Reviews.Title: Stopped Working After 13 Months
Reviews.Author: Jase Carter
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in November 2012. Three days ago, I turned it on and the screen was much darker than usual and any images were extremely blurry. The sound was fine but there was an extreme lag in the picture that caused a psychedelic effect, making it unwatchable. After five minutes, the screen returned to normal.This problem has worsened since it first happened. It now takes the TV about 30 minutes for the blurry problem to be fixed, and I'm confident the TV will soon be unusable.This television was more expensive than some comparable models when I bought it, and I was OK with that. I assumed the Sony brand would be more reliable. Now, I'm left with a broken television I spent more than $550 on, and only used for a little more than a year.

Reviews.Title: Great picture.
Reviews.Author: Billy H. Smith
Reviews.Content: easy to hook up, just the right size, lowest price on the enternet, my son loves it in his room.

Reviews.Title: Nice when it works
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: I bought this "used like new" from an Amazon vendor who assured me the model I bought was not a floor model, had not been previously used or refurbished and had only been taken out of the box to ensure all parts were present as they had purchased from a warehouse on overstock. So the unit was essentially new but had to be marked used. It lasted three months before mysteriously turning off despite power being supplied in the middle of a movie and would not respond to remote control or unplugging and then plugging back in. We also tried other outlets in the house and nothing worked. The red standby light would not even come on. I contacted Sony about it and long story short they gave me a hard time about it and did not want to cover because of the supposed used condition and not being covered under warranty. They did finally supply me with a refurbished unit which hasnt given us any problems but seems to be a bit grainy-er in its resolution. I am disappointed that I go to a trusted name like Sony and get crap that goes on me in 3 months and they want to jerk me around about warranty issues when I paid good  money for it. Not sure if I would go to Sony again after this ordeal.

Reviews.Title: better than expected
Reviews.Author: plj
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent quality t.v.  It is everything they said it would be and more.  Deffinatly the nicest picture of all our televisions.  In fact bough it for the garage, and ended up putting it in the family room.

Reviews.Title: Looks Great
Reviews.Author: John E Hallinan
Reviews.Content: This is the best T.V I have ever looked at. I am planning to buy another one soon maybe a 60 in. one for the game. They did ship this T.V very fast.  Thanks

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Purchase
Reviews.Author: jal "jal"
Reviews.Content: It is a great tv and, as always, dealing with Amazon a pleasure.  It was easy to hook-up and I have not had any problems at all.

Reviews.Title: Almost a 5 star!
Reviews.Author: FF
Reviews.Content: I do really like this TV. It's definition is gorgeous, it works well in every way I've tried using it (mainly console and PC gaming with a lovely display), and now, more than half a year after I've purchased it, almost no technical problems to report.I wanted something at about that price with a great resolution, VGA/HDMI capability, and a large enough screen to please, but not completely overwhelm my small apartment's living room. The colours are lovely (important feature for me as I do a fair bit of digital art), the remote functions, and while I haven't tried every function and tool in it's arsenal, I'm very satisfiedI think my only criticisms are that it only has two HDMI inputs, and that it is fairly wobbly on it's stand without being tied down or anchored to anything.The limited inputs are a small negative for an overall very lovely package. I just happen to have all of my devices I use with this hook up via HDMI, so I end up finding myself playing the old switch the cable dance semi-frequently. My lazy tendencies aside, it's a functional set up.Wobbliness: a slightly more concerning issue, and one that makes me glad I live with neither animals nor small children. The TV is not quite to the point where you look at it funny and it'll tip over, but I could very well see someone accidentally nudging it and either toppling the setup (it's quite light- if it weren't too long to comfortably pick up solo it'd be a breeze to move), or damaging the stand.That being said, I would almost certainly go for the same model, if at least brand of TV.

Reviews.Title: Best tv i've had
Reviews.Author: El_Flash
Reviews.Content: I decided to not go for a "smart tv" and save some money. This tv has a wonderful picture, and you just cant beat the look and feel of a Sony. Perfect for watching sports and playing the PS3. I have had no picture problems.Does take a little tinkering to get the picture quality u want, the game mode works wonderful for just about anything you watch though.The speakers are not great, but i hooked mine up to my sony's stereo speakers and it now sounds amazing. Bottom line for the price around $500 when i purchased mine, its a fantastic product.

Reviews.Title: WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR
Reviews.Author: felipe
Reviews.Content: AFORDABLE TV WITH GREAT IMAGE AND OK SOUND.PC VGA INPUT IS GREAT FOR USING YOUR LAPTOP AS A DVD PLAYER.NO 3D OR SMART I DONT NEED IT.

Reviews.Title: brava tv
Reviews.Author: Jean M. Walsh "jeannie"
Reviews.Content: received tv, packing job was excellent. The tv is nice quality the sound is a little different might be the speakers don't know but over all I like what I bought

Reviews.Title: Brilliant colors and clarity!
Reviews.Author: Sid
Reviews.Content: Sony has always been my first choice for TVs for its brilliant colors and clarity. Movie watching experience is the best. I am in love with this model after watching Life Of Pi at home (second time, first was in a theater). This movie has vivid and vibrant colors, was a true test for the TV picture quality. Great Price, Great Picture quality...Ultimate experience.

Reviews.Title: I'm in TV heaven now :D
Reviews.Author: SJW
Reviews.Content: Been having awesome results with Amazon products I've ordered lately & this tv is no exception.  The picture is crisp, clear & vivid w/1080p.  Love all the choices for type of picture (sports, cinema, etc.), size of picture, etc.  I'm a SONY girl & wanted a Bravia so I took advantage of the Black Friday sale last November on Amazon ... kinda feel like I got away w/something lol.  Has all the extras I will ever need on my tv (& more) but some of you way-geek-smart folks might need even more options.  Sound is excellent, esp on surround option which is lush.  TV has a myriad of options to tailor every avenue of your viewing pleasure & I like that a lot.  Lovin' me this SONY Bravia.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia KDL42EX440 42-inch 1080p LED HDTV ( Black )
Reviews.Author: James R. Francis
Reviews.Content: I chose this model after reading all of the reviews on it and wasn't dissappointed after I got it. At a little over thirty pounds it is quite a bit lighter than the one hundred sixty plus pound Sony KV32S66 of mine that just went out after thirteen years of use. The newer sets definitely have a better picture but only have a life span of about five years. I have always had Sony sets because of their quality. I am very happy with this order as it was shipped promptly and delivered in excellent condition.

Reviews.Title: SONY. MAKE. BELIEVE.
Reviews.Author: Kenneth D. Calderon
Reviews.Content: THE TV WORKS LIKE A CHARM, BUT I HAVE TWO COMPLAINS. IT NEEDS AT LEAST ONE MORE HDMI AND THE SCREEN BRIGHTNESS IT'S TO DIM/DARK. I WISH THE SCREEN WAS A LITTLE BRIGHTER!

Reviews.Title: except for the pixelation
Reviews.Author: tjb
Reviews.Content: this was a great TV with a clear, sharp picture and beautiful colors. After a few days I noticed black spots on the screen, determined to be bad pixels. A call to Amazon for the free 30 day tech support was easy and very helpful. After a few quick tests which I performed as we spoke, they offered free shipping to return the TV, in home service, or an exchange. Because I like the tv I asked for an exchange but they were not in stock. I since learned there is a newer model and have ordered that instead. I am a Prime member and am impressed with how well Amazon handled this and how it easy it was to work out the details.

Reviews.Title: RECIBIDO
Reviews.Author: Adelis Alvarado
Reviews.Content: EXCELENTE VENDEDOR REALIZARE MAS COMPRAS EN EL FUTURO, QUEDE SATISFECHO CON EL PRODUCTO Y HARE RECOMENDACIONES A TODOS LOS AMIGOS

Reviews.Title: sony bravia kdl42ex440
Reviews.Author: Seen
Reviews.Content: Does anyone knows if sony bravia kdl42ex440, 110~240 volts, 50/60 hertz, 95W, LCD TV/TV VCL works in Europe? I baught this kind to shipped but I am worried if this would work.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality, a few minor annoyances.
Reviews.Author: B. Causey
Reviews.Content: The picture quality on this set when properly calibrated is great. It's on par with even more expensive sets by both Sony and Samsung. However, it does have a few flaws. The input selection leaves a lot to be desired, even from an entry level television. And the set (as most LED sets do) suffers from the corners of the screen appearing brighter than the rest when watching a dark movie (or anything in 4:3 mode) in a dark room.For anyone who doesn't turn the lights off or at least keeps some sort of ambient lighting in the room to offset the flash-lighting, it's an amazing TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Hey this TV is great, clear picture and very easy to use. Well worth the price. It may not have the bells and whistles as a Samsung but it does what it is suppose to do!

Reviews.Title: Good Tv!
Reviews.Author: lad
Reviews.Content: I would have given this Tv 5 stars if it weren't for the stand.  It is defective!  I lined it up with the screw holes and tried to screw it in.  It would not!  I had my husband do it and he told me it could not be done.  There was no way that the screw holes would line up with the stand.  So now I will be putting it up on the wall.  Just be aware of this problem if you don 't want to put it up on the wall.  Luckily I do not care.  Other than that, I like the tv.  Good picture and sound.  The best sound in my opinion for a flat screen.  It could have been a little thinner.  I guess the sound would not have been good if it had.

Reviews.Title: 30 years of loyal sony tv  buying destroyed! BEWARE.
Reviews.Author: steve gehrig
Reviews.Content: do not buy this tv..or any sony product! sorry to say that.  i have been a loyal sony customer since the mid 70s. i bought this tv in sept 2012. within 2 months it would not even turn on. i called my cable company to see if it was the cable feed and we got the tv to work again but only for a few days. then nothing got it to even turn on. then the nightmares began with sony customer service. there are far too many calls and incidents to share.  but i was told a service rep would could come out and look at the tv and decide its fate. i gave my phone number and email to customer service. after 2 weeks and hearing nothing i called sony again and was told that sony decided the tv would be replaced. i asked why a service rep never showed up or why i did not get a call or  email and no one knew.when the new tv arrived i was shocked to see it was not a new one but a refurbished one i called sony again but was reassured that the new tv had a 2year warranty and it was as good as new. so i set up the tv . then i had to package up the old tv in the refurbished packaging and call fed ex to pick it up. i was also required to give a credit card number .within 6 hours the new tv developed a horizontal strip an inch wide with no picture!!! at least the old tv took 2months to go bad.more calls to sony and so many excuses and misdirections and run runarounds. sony solution was to send me yet another refurbished tv. i refused. i finally, after many calls and many people passing me on got sony to agree sending a new tv. BUT that tv would not get a 2 year warranty like the refurbished tv nor a 1 year warranty like the first tv..the warranty on this supposed new tv would be RETROACTIVE to my purchase in sept!!!!! in the meantime i got an e mail saying the new tv would arrive friday. the day i got that email i got a phone call saying the email would be delivered on Tuesday!!!  thats today. we shall see if it arrives and how long it lasts.in the meantime i wrote to sony that offering a 2 year warranty on a refurbished tv and only a  8 month warranty on a new tv was not acceptable. no response. i resent that email again today and also to other sony customer service address i received a phone call from sony customer service today and was advised that the retroactive warranty policy was  not going to changei argued that that was unacceptable, rude and precisely why sony was in decline. the customer service rep stood firm.i am disgusted.  i will never buy anything sony again.  having  a new tv die in 2 months and the replacement die in 6 hours speaks to sony's quality issues. the customer service was hideous .you have been warned! avoid sony. peroid

Reviews.Title: Video as expected, but, Sound should be better for Sony.
Reviews.Author: Suzanne
Reviews.Content: I made the purchase about a month ago, but, I needed some strong arms to help with all the moving around.  I don't have HD, so, depending on the broadcast the video is average to very good.  I believe it's as good as my Panasonic 32" LCD.  I don't see any of the trailing Consumer Reports warned about.  I could have used another video input for my VCR, but, I'll have to run it through one of my DVD players.  The ad boasted a composite and component, but, you can only use one at a time.  I guess that's on the dealer, but, I got a speedy delivery with no extra charge. I thought the sound quality would be better as my Consumer Reports almost always rates Sony's sound better than Panasonic, but, it's disappointing.  There is an equalizer to adjust, but, no success there.  I haven't heard enough TV's to know if there are any better.  There's no easy way to hook it up to the stereo and be able to adjust the volume.  I give it a 3.5 to 3.75 stars.  I don't know what's taking so long to bring LCD's up to the quality level of the video and sound of the old tubes, so, as far as I can tell this maybe as good as it gets for any TV unless you can find an excellent picture and/or sound elsewhere.  I'm not rounding up my ratings unitl they bring the quality of LCD's up. I think this is fair considering how long they've been around, and, that this is one of the most powerful corporations.

Reviews.Title: What is a headline?
Reviews.Author: Timothy St. Aubin
Reviews.Content: The Sony Bravia is working just fine.  However, would have preferred 120 HZ in lie of 60 HZ.  Between our two residences we have (7) flat screens.  Of all of them from Sony, Toshiba, and Samsung.  The Samsungs, in my opinion surpass the others.

Reviews.Title: This Sony Bravia is more LCD than LED technology
Reviews.Author: DKM
Reviews.Content: I thought I was buying an LED television.  The product is NEVER advertised as LCD until you look at the Operating Instructions, which are for a LCD TV.Also, the back of the television says LCD.I have spoken with a Sony store and learned that this TV is mostly LCD with LED only on the edge !!!!It should be advertised as such by Amazon and the distributor.I feel cheated.Quality of the picture requires lots of fiddling with the settings.

Reviews.Title: Audio problems
Reviews.Author: Clayton Roberts
Reviews.Content: Severe audio distortion through hdmi. I tried multiple hdmi cables and multiple media sources. It was the tv and I'm returning it.

Reviews.Title: Poor sound quality.
Reviews.Author: rebecca keltner
Reviews.Content: The video quality is just fine, however, the sound is horrible. It comes out weakly and filtered. We had to connect it to a stereo to hear better, but that only works with movies and not basic television.

Reviews.Title: Tuning in nearby stations awkward
Reviews.Author: Advisor
Reviews.Content: These days many channels have nearby RF numbers. For example, in Tucson using a roof antenna with the auto scan, the TV finds station KHRR-DT (Telemundo) is 40.1, Exitos 40.2, and S.O.I. is 40.3. Using the up-down channel selector on the remote, Telemundo and Exitos switch back and forth fine, but S.O.I. will not display. Instead, the TV comes up with an information box that says "signal cannot be decoded". But if I first type in any number far from 40, say 8 or 50, and then type into the controller 40.3, S.O.I. comes in just fine. This is the ONLY way to see this channel. If I now jump to another channel I can jump back, but if I use the up-down channel switch, we're back to "signal cannot be decoded". Annoying.

Reviews.Title: Not a 120hz. TV as presented.
Reviews.Author: Eleanor Steele
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed after delivery of the Sony TV to find that it is not a 120hz. as presented in the information I got from the Amazon website.  Not until we had taken delivery of the set did I realize it is a 60hz. refresh rate.  As some of you may know, the pricing, and information on the website changes almost from hour to hour, so if you order during one of those "off" times,  too bad.  Guess we are stuck with a set that is not up to what we wanted. To Amazon's credit, they do now state that the set is a 60hz refresh rate.

Reviews.Title: Sony TV
Reviews.Author: Amar Jindal
Reviews.Content: Sony TV is a good product but it is too plain, it need to be updted to match other manfactures like Samsung or LG TVs.
